title: axis_deer_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Axis Deer or Chital ([i]Axis axis[/i]) is a species of deer native to the Indian subcontinent.

Axis Deer (the Friend) is presented with noticibly [[dark_skin|darker skin]] than most of the other Friends.

She appears briefly in Episode 2 as one of the several Friends encountered in the Jungle Area. Her part consists of revealing her dirt-eating tendencies, noting that she does it for the salt. In turn, this makes fan depictions of her obsessed with eating nothing but dirt, salt or salty things.
other_names: アクシスジカ(けものフレンズ)

title: nitorinc.
body:
A [i][[Warioware]][/i]-like game collaboration between [i][[Touhou]][/i] fans, consisting of multiple microgames.

The official story goes that [[Kawashiro Nitori]] discovered video games, and she wants to capitalize on them by making as many as she can, as quickly as she can and sell them to Gensokyo. The microgames feature just about any character from [i]Touhou[/i] canon doing whatever the commands allow for.

As of July 29, 2017, the game has a demo. Players can still submit ideas to the project if they would like.

h4. External Links
* "Official Tumblr":http://nitorinc.tumblr.com/
* "Official Twitter":https://twitter.com/nitorinc
* "Page on Reddit":https://www.reddit.com/r/touhou/comments/6qc2dr/redditaisai_nitorinc_touhou_microgame_demo/?st=j5pjn2md&sh=b418669c

title: time_signature
body:
Numbers written at the start of [[sheet music]] indicating the number of beats in a bar. These are usually two numbers written one above the other after the key signature ([[sharp sign|sharps]] or [[flat sign|flats]] at the start of the line), although other varieties such as time symbols and mixed or fractional signatures do exist, and not all music has a time signature.

If the number of beats in a bar changes at any point in the music, there will be a new time signature at that point, unless there was no time signature or a mixed signature at the start.

title: urna
body:
白毫 (Chinese: bai hao / Japanese: byakugou)
Also known as 白毫相 (Chinese: baihao xiang / Japanese: byakugou-sou)

A lock of white hair on the [[forehead]] of Buddhist images, depicted as a spiral or circular dot.

(Note that the term bai hao is also used for the silver hairs on "white tea":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_tea], which are usually called mouji [毛茸] in Japanese.)

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urna]

h4.See also

* [[Buddhism]]
* [[statue]]

title: battle_pencil
body:
A game that plays similar to Long Dice and Pencil Cricket. The players roll hexagonal pencils with different moves and effects printed on each side, and the side facing up will be the status used. One can attach caps to their pencil to use equipment, items, or summons/pets, or even use eraser assists.

Battle Pencils tend to come with characters attached, similar to [i][[Bikkuriman]][/i]. The game is popular among school children, though some young adults still play.

title: gundam_tryon_3
body:
More properly known as the Saikyou Kidou Tryon 3, this is a custom [[ZZ Gundam]] with heavy super robot influences ([[Brave Series]] and [[Daitarn 3]]). It is a combining mecha with three components: the Riku Tryon (backpack and chest emblem), Sora Tryon (legs and hips) and Umi Tryon (arms and torso).

Appears in [[Gundam Build Fighters Try]], designed and primarily operated by [[Sakai Minato]].

title: troll_(homestuck)
body:
A race of aliens from the Planet Alternia/Beforus, and a major race in [i][[Homestuck]][/i]. Based off of Internet trolls, and each troll has their own symbol and typing quirk. The previous winners of Sburb were of this race, and created Earth.

Depicted as [[grey skin]]ned humanoids with [[yellow sclera]] and [[black hair]], as well as candy corn-colored [[horns]].

title: monk_spade
body:
Chinese: 月牙鏟 (Traditional) / 月牙铲 (Simplified)
Pronunciation: Yueya-chan (Chinese) / Getsugasan (Japanese)
English: Monk's Spade

A type of Chinese [[polearm]].

[[Sha Wujing]]'s Monster Subduing Treasure Staff (降妖宝杖, Jian Yao baozhang) in [[Journey to the West]] and [[Lu Zhishen]]'s zen staff (禅杖, Chan zhang) in [[Water Margin]] are often described as monk's spades.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monk%27s_spade]

title: srikandi
body: [b]Shikhandi [/b](Sanskrit: शिखण्डी, Śikhaṇḍī, lit. lock on the crown of the head) is a character in the Hindu epic, the Mahabharata. Reincarnation of Amba, a princess who was spurned by Bhisma because of his celibacy vow, who swore to kill him for his humiliation. He was born as a girl child named 'Shikhandini' to Drupada after much penance to Lord Shiva who promised that his child will attain sex change at a later stage, the king of Panchala. Shikhandi fought in the Kurukshetra war on the side of the Pandavas, along with his father Drupada and brother Dhristadyumna.

title: yoru_wa_mijikashi_arukeyo_otome
body:
(よるはみじかしあるけよおとめ, lit. The Spring Night is Short, Move It Girl!) 

A Japanese novel by [[Morimi Tomihiko]] that was published in November 2006 by Kadokawa Shoten. It was also adapted into 5 volume manga series illustrated by [[Kotone Ranmaru]].

Both the novel and the manga series detail the exploits of the unnamed protagonist who is falls in love with "[[Kurokami no Otome]]", his junior in a college club, and struggles daily to be noticed by her. However, “Kurokami no Otome” is naïve and unsophisticated and is completely indifferent to him. This comical love fantasy depicts funny and interesting daily happenings in the city of Kyoto. 

h4. Characters

* [[senpai_(yoru_wa_mijikashi_arukeyo_otome)|Senpai]]
* [[Kurokami no Otome]]
* [[Hanuki Ryouko]]
* [[Higuchi Seitarou]]
* [[gakuensai jimukyokuchou|Kitaooji / Gakuensai Jimukyokuchou]]
* [[Toudou-san]]
* [[Furuhonichi no Kamisama]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia Entry":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Night_Is_Short,_Walk_on_Girl
* "Author 's Homepage":http://d.hatena.ne.jp/Tomio/
* "Kadokawa Shoten's Official [i]Yoru wa mijikashi Arukeyo Otome[/i] Page ":http://www.kadokawa.co.jp/sp/200611-07/

title: amitabha
body:
The principal [[buddha]] of Pure Land sect of Mahayana [[Buddhism]]. Also known as Amitayus, and rendered as "Amida" in Japanese. 

[[Mida no jouin]] was used far more than the regular [[dhyana mudra]] in Japanese statuary as a way of distinguishing him from other buddhas. 

Famously depicted in the form of the Daibutsu, the 13.35 meter tall statue at the Koutoku-in Temple in Kamakura.

title: akehoshi_subaru
body:
[i][[Ensemble Stars!]][/i] character. A second year student and a member of [[trickstar (ensemble stars!)|Trickstar]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[orange hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. At school, he wears the standard [[yumenosaki school uniform|Yumenosaki uniform]], consisting on [[plaid pants]], a [[blazer]] with a [[hood]] and [[necktie]]. For Trickstar, he wears a [[plaid jacket]] with similar pants.

A hardworking mood-maker who thinks of everything in a positive light, Subaru's always on the go, never settling down. He likes money (not in a materialistic way; he just likes shiny things and loves coins regardless of the value) and has a dog named [[daikichi (ensemble stars!)|Daikichi]]. Subaru is also best friends with [[hidaka_hokuto|Hokuto Hidaka]]

He's the first student [[anzu (ensemble stars!)|Anzu]] meets when entering Yumenosaki. He has a deceased father who used to be an idol as well.

title: dragonfly

title: cutting_mat
body:
A type of durable mat made from self-healing plastic that is less damaging to blades than cutting into hard surfaces. They are designed for activities such as [[model|model building]], [[sewing]], and other [[crafting|arts and crafts]]. Most cutting mats are green or black and have grid patterns to facilitate measuring lengths and angles of the materials being cut.

Compare with a [[cutting board]], which is usually wooden and made for food preparation.

h4.See also
* [[boxcutter]]

title: obidome
body:
Obidome (帯留め, おびどめ) are small brooches worn threaded onto the obijime, making a charming decoration on the front of the obi. Can be made of wood, ceramic, resin, mother-of-pearl, or precious metals. Often in designs such as flowers, small objects, or animals.
The back surface will almost always be flat with two closely-spaced raised rectangular holes, used for sliding the obidome over the thin flat obijime cord.

When an obijime is made specifically to be worn with obidome, it will be thinner and flatter than average, and known as sanbu-himo.

These are generally the only jewelry that is acceptable to wear with kimono (other than a wedding band or tasteful watch). Typically an informal item, even when made with precious gems and are only acceptable with more casual or funky outfits. 

However, Maiko will wear a very large and elaborate form of obidome known as pocchiri with their hikizuri. These are often made of incredibly fine materials such as gold and diamonds or emeralds, as well as very detailed enamel workmanship. They are also much larger than normal obidome.


h4. External link 

* "Kimono breakdown":https://i.pinimg.com/736x/e1/ae/33/e1ae334d27775ba95b8753a054e2a168--traditional-japanese-kimono-traditional-dresses.jpg

* "Obidome being worn":http://www.immortalgeisha.com/wiki/images/c/c5/Obidome_being_worn.jpg

* [[Japanese clothes]]

title: montgomery_(milihime_taisen)
body:
Bernard Law Montgomery was a British Army Officer. He is famous for commanding the British 8th Army in North Africa, the command of allied units in Operation Overlord, and the failed invasion of Operation Market Garden.

In [[Milihime Taisen]], Montgomery is depicted as an [[AEC Armored Command Vehicle]] [[mecha musume]], who has [[short hair|short]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]] and enjoys [[teacup|tea]]. She wears a [[beret]], a [[bandana]] or [[scarf]], a [[sweater]], and [[shorts]]. Because of her first CG, she is sometimes depicted being under [[shade]].

title: kenshin_kagemitsu
body:
A [i][[Touken Ranbu]][/i] character.

He is based off of an unnamed [[tantou]] once in the possession of [[Uesugi Kenshin]]. On its base was engraved the  phrase "Chichibu Daibosatsu" (秩父大菩薩) in Sanskrit.

His in-game character is based around maturity, and lives by a code of self-control. While he believes that self-control is the key to being adult, his own shortcomings cause him to act childish.

Voiced by [[Yonaga Tsubasa]]. Character designer is [[Homerun Ken]].

title: excalibur_(soul_eater)
body:
Character from [[Soul Eater]]; his legend began in the 12th century. Voiced by [[Koyasu Takehito]] (JP) and Troy Baker (EN).

Much like his counterpart in Arturian legend, he takes on the form of a powerful [[sword]] when in the hands of a Meister.

Such strength, however, comes at a price; Excalibur is extremely abrasive, annoying, and an egotistical attention seeker that very few Meisters stay with him for long.

Thanks to his attention-seeking antics (complete with his own theme song, too) people who have encountered Excalibur in all his irritating glory have a facial expression reserved for it (the [[Excalibur face]]).

title: crow_(show_by_rock!!)
body:
Lead vocalist and guitarist for the band ShinganCrimsonZ in [i][[Show By Rock!!]][/i]. 

He acts as a little brother to the band, often being loud, brash, and somewhat defensive about his farm-boy upbringing. It was his idea to call his fans "cattle" based on this.

Has [[multicolored_hair|multicolored]] [[red_hair|red]] and [[black_hair|black]] hair, and tends to wear a red [[trench coat]].


Apparently some sort of Hedgehog.

title: kitajima_sara
body: A character from the [[yuri]] eroge series [[Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo]].  Paired with [[Kitajima Kaede]], her older cousin.  She currently works as a very well-known model.  Something of a crybaby who worked hard to become more outgoing and self-reliant out of her adoration and love for Kaede.

title: kitajima_kaede
body: A character from the [[yuri]] eroge series [[Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo]].  Paired with [[Kitajima Sara]].  Kaede is a well-known and respected member of the student body, but is extremely uncomfortable being the center of attention of any sort, and takes care not to stand out too much in any fashion.  Her tendency to fade into the background often clashes with Sara's outgoing and naturally attention-drawing personality.

title: sawaguchi_mai
body: A character from the [[yuri]] eroge series [[Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo]].  Paired with [[Kawamura Reo]].  An outgoing, good-natured girl from a warm, middle-class family.  After Reo confesses her feelings, Mai becomes the aggressor in the relationship, much to Reo's continuing embarrassment.

title: kawamura_reo
body: A character from the [[yuri]] eroge series [[Sono Hanabira ni Kuchizuke wo]].  Paired with [[Sawaguchi Mai]].  A short [[tsundere]] who constantly argues with Mai, she suddenly confesses her feelings one day after classes.  She is popular with her classmates because of her small demeanor and doll-like beauty, but she is also feared for her harsh temper.  A willful girl who has a tendency to live on convenience store junk food, which is only exacerbated by the tensions between her well-to-do parents.

I'm 14 years old.
Gen-chan is Shanshio's friend![/quote]

title: nippon_ichi
body:
Nippon Ichi Software, sometimes shortened as simply "NIS", is a Japanese video game developer company known for their anime-styled series of SRPGs. Though largely stand-alone, most games appear to be connected in some form through parallel dimensions or some such and crossovers are normal. Most recently, there was even a crossover character between NIS’ [[Soul Cradle|Soul Nomad]] (Which also featured characters from other NIS games) and Vanillaware’s [[GrimGrimoire|GrimGrimoire]]. Most of the character designs have been done by [[ryoji_(nomura_ryouji)|Nomura Ryoji]] and [[Harada Takehito]].

h4.See also

* [[List of Nippon Ichi characters]]

title: yamine_aku
body:
h4. Yamine Aku (闇音アク)

A fanmade Vocaloid based on [[Vocalod]] [[Hatsune Miku]]. She is [[dark skin]]ned, has [[purple eyes]], and has long [[white hair]] in [[twintails]]. There are two versions of her; a young version that wears a dark-purple [[gothic lolita]]-style outfit. And an older version, in which she wears a leather [[swimsuit]], long jacket and [[thigh boots]].

She is also termed as an "Anti-Vocaloid" or "X-loid".

title: narwhal_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Narwhal ([i]Monodon monoceros[/i]) is a medium-sized toothed whale known for their massive tusk, usually a left canine. Note that the males are typically the ones with a tusk. Females do, however, occasionally grow a tusk. They live in the Arctic seas.

Narwhal (the Friend) wears a [[sailor dress]] with the distinctive pattern of the Narwhal, fitting with the usual "Marine Fashion" motif of the cetacean Friends. She wields right-handedly a lance or sword based on the Narwhal's tusk. Her hair is styled like the front and fins of the Narwhal, including a blowhole and a long lock of hair to her left representing her actual tusk. Of course, she has the tail of the Narwhal.
other_names: イッカク(けものフレンズ)

title: sichte_meister
body:
Sichte is the leader of the RKS Strike Force, a special portion of RKS, from the Doujin soft [[Rosenkreuzstilette]]. She is a mature, level-headed decision maker with keen judgment who has trouble having faith in those older than her. She is good friends with [[Grolla Seyfarth]] and dreams of a world where Magi can live peacefully.

Her weapon, the Die Geplante Zukunft, allows her to stop time. She also has an endless supply of knives that she can place all over the place when time is stopped, having them home in on her opponent. Because of this power, she is homage to [[Dio Brando]] from [[Jojo no Kimyou na Bouken]], much like [[Izayoi Sakuya]] from the [[Touhou]] series and Zephyr from [[Castlevania: Dawn of Sorrow]], who both also have similar abilities to Dio.

She is also known for her [[large breasts]] as well. In [[Rosenkreuzstilette Freudenstachel]], her clothes have been torn and she now also wears a black bra underneath her torn shirt as well as black [[armbands]].

title: bionic_commando
body:
[b]Bionic Commando[/b] is a series of [[military]] and [[science fiction]] [[video game]] action series created by [[Capcom]] company.

The first game in the series was released in Japan as [b]Top Secret[/b] (Japanese: トップシークレット,, Hepburn: Toppu Shīkuretto?), a 1987 action platform game released for the arcades. It was later released for several home computers (ported by Software Creations and published by Go!). The music from the arcade game was created by female composer Fujita Harumi.

Capcom later produced a home version for the [[NES]] console titled Bionic Commando that was drastically different from the original arcade game. This version included some songs from the arcade as well as original new music created by female composer Tamiya Junko. Her soundtrack has become famous over the years and is still considered one of the best and most recognizable videogame music ever made.  

The game was advertised in the United States as a sequel to Commando, going as far to refer to the game's main character as Super Joe (the protagonist of Commando) in the promotional brochure, who was originally an unnamed member of a "special commando unit" in the Japanese and World versions.

The series is notable for being one of few instances of a platform game in which the player cannot jump. To cross gaps or climb ledges, the [[cyborg]] hero must use his bionic arm. This was the first game to feature a grappling gun/hook, which later appeared in games such as Earthworm Jim and Tomb Raider.

A version of the NES game was released in 1992 for the [[Game Boy]] handheld console. A [[Game Boy Color]] game called [b]Bionic Commando: Elite Forces[/b] was released in 1999. Another remake of the NES version called [b]Bionic Commando Rearmed[/b] was released for Xbox Live Arcade, PlayStation Network and Windows in 2008. 

A direct third person action sequel to the classic Bionic Commando and its enhanced remake was released in 2009 for the [[Playstation 3]] and the [[Xbox 360]] home consoles. A more immediate sequel to Rearmed was released for the Xbox Live Arcade and the PlayStation Network in 2011.

h4. See also

* [[Nathan Spencer]]

title: japanese_otter_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Japanese Otter ([i]Lutra nippon[/i]) is, obviously, the Japanese variant of the Eurasian Otter. The species has been officially considered to be extinct in 2012, the last official sighting being in 1979. However, there has been several unofficial sightings of the animal ever since.

Japanese Otter (The Friend) resembles an orangish-brown haired and costumed [[small-clawed_otter_(kemono_friends)|Small-Clawed Otter]] with the main differences aside from color being shorter bangs and a shy demeanor. Considered extinct, [[empty_eyes|she also lacks the shine of her eyes]].

News of video sightings on Tsushima Island of an indeterminate otter (either a bonafide Japanese Otter or a migrating Eurasian Otter) in February 2017 lead to some hope for the Japanese Otter. In turn, this sparked a trend to draw her with highlights on her eyes, including producing them at the sight of the actual animal.
other_names: ニホンカワウソ(けものフレンズ)

title: shinsha-chan
body:
Official name: シンシャ (Shinsha) 
Pixiv tag: しゃちっ娘 (Shachikko, lit. Orca-girl)

An original Orca-girl first created by [[Shinkai no Shachi]] ("Deep-sea Orca"). She is a tall young lady with [[very long hair|very long]] [[black hair]] that [[ahoge|sticks up at the top]], and with [[two side up|small portions tied off on each side]] using round, white [[hair ornament]]s, resembling the head and fins of a [[orca|killer whale]]. She wears a [[long dress|long]] [[white dress]] and [[sandals]] - sometimes her dress is [[strapless dress|strapless]], sometimes not. Some depictions give her black bracelets that look strikingly similar to [[Ikamusume]]'s blue bangles, though she is most often drawn without them.

She has no [[monster girl|non-human]] features, making her a completely [[personification|personified]] killer whale.

While the Pixiv tag that refers to her just means "Orca-girl", she remains the sole occupant of the tag. Use discretion if this ever changes.

h4. See Also

* [[Shinkai no Shachi]]
* [[Orca]]
* [[fish girl]]
* [[personification]]

She's deeply in love with [[Nyarlathotep (Nyaruko-san)|Nyaruko]], despite bad relations between the Ctughan and the Nyarlathotepan races. title: tetrapodal_mecha_panther
body:
A character from the [[Strider (video game)]] franchise. It appears in the original Strider arcade videogame from 1989 as well as the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series of fighting games released years later.

The [b]Tetrapodal Mecha Panther[/b] (also known as [b]Option B[/b]) is a combat [[robot]] [[smilodon]] that helps the main character [[Strider Hiryuu]] during his quest. It is formed by the union of two [[Dipodal Saucer]] robots (also known as [i]Option A[/i]) after the proper [[transformation]] power up is obtained.

title: lifestealer_(dota)
body:
[b]N'aix[/b] the [b]Lifestealer[/b] is a vicious melee Strength hero whose abilities give him the power to bring down durable heroes quickly, while sustaining his health from absorbing the very life of his enemies.

[b]Lore:[/b] 	In the dungeons of Devarque, a vengeful wizard lay in shackles, plotting his escape. He shared his cell with a gibbering creature known as N'aix, a thief cursed by the Vile Council with longevity, so that its life-sentence for theft and cozening might be as punishing as possible. Over the years, its chains had corroded, along with its sanity; N'aix retained no memory of its former life and no longer dreamt of escape. Seeing a perfect vessel for his plans, the wizard wove a spell of Infestation and cast his life-force into N'aix's body, intending to compel N'aix to sacrifice itself in a frenzy of violence while the mage returned to his body and crept away unnoticed. Instead, the wizard found his mind caught in a vortex of madness so powerful that it swept away his plans and shattered his will. Jarred to consciousness by the sudden infusion of fresh life, N'aix woke from its nightmare of madness and obeyed the disembodied voice that filled its skull, which had only the one thought: To escape. In that moment Lifestealer was born. The creature cast its mind into dungeon guards and soldiers, compelling them to open locks and cut down their companions, opening an unobstructed path to freedom while feeding on their lives. Lifestealer still wears the broken shackles as a warning that none may hold him, but on the inside remains a prisoner. Two minds inhabit the single form--a nameless creature of malevolent cunning, and the Master whose voice he pretends to obey.

title: tasmanian_devil_(kemono_friends)
body:
A [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i] character. She is one of many "Friends" in Japari Park.

The Tasmanian Devil ([i]Sarcophilus harrisii[/i]) is a Marsupial resembling somewhat a wolverine and was mistakenly known as a fearsome, ravenous beast. They originally evolved in mainland Australia but they were extirpated and relegated to Tasmania thousands of years before the present. (See "[[australian_devil_(kemono_friends)|Australian Devil]]")

She appears briefly in Episode 2 as one of the several Friends encountered in the Jungle Area, simply presenting herself with an adorably menacing pose.

title: tsuneki_hikari
body:
Character from the 2017 original anime [[Seiren]]. 

Has dark [[blue eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] that's tied into a [[side ponytail]] on her left. She wears no cardigan, only a basic [[white shirt]].

From "the early character reveals on ANN":http://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2016-11-25/seiren-original-anime-reveals-3-more-cast-members-character-designs/.109183 :
[quote]
ANN said:
A "modern day meddling princess." She is always cheerful and is the class idol of class 2-B at Teruhi Higashi High School. She was the runner-up of last year's "Miss Santa Contest," and has an exclusive seat on the terrace. She loves to eat, and is occasionally stubborn.
[/quote]

She is voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]].

It evolves into [[Chansey]] when leveled up holding the [i]Oval Stone[/i] during daytime.

Prior Pokémon: [[Mime Jr.]]

title: bilrer
body:
A character from the [[Macross]] series. He appears in the [[Macross Frontier]] TV series from 2008.

[b]Bilrer[/b] is an alien [[Zentradi]] [[giant]] mogul who owns the [[S.M.S.]] private army. 

He looks a lot like an older version of [[Vrlitwhai Kridanik]] from [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982. Bilrer is also a [[cyborg]].

title: suzuka_hime
body:
A playable character in Super Robot Taisen - OG Saga: Endless Frontier. She is voiced by [[Noto Mamiko]].

Princess of the Shiki-Oni kingdom, she joins [[Harken Browning]] and [[Nanbu Kaguya]] to discover the mystery of their worlds, and why her fiance is acting rather strangely.

She dances while using her fans in battle, alongside Jyaki-GUN-Oh, a heavily-armed combat puppet made to look like a mech.

Is [[flat_chest|flat]], but don't tell her that to her face.

title: rhapsodia
body: A side story to [i][[Gensou Suikoden IV]][/i]. [i]Rhapsodia​[/i], titled [i]Suikoden Tactics[/i] in the English translation, is a tactical RPG that takes place shortly after [i]Gensou Suikoden IV[/i]. Its main purpose is to explain the origin and nature of [i]Gensou Suikoden IV[/i]'s Rune Cannons, and to explain why those powerful weapons are no longer commonplace in the other games of the [i][[Gensou Suikoden]][/i] series (all of which take place well after [i]Gensou Suikoden IV[/i]).

title: jc_denton
body:
The main protagonist of the first person [[cyberpunk]] action/RPG [[video game]], [[Deus Ex]] (2000).

[b]J.C. Denton[/b] is an advanced nanotechnological [[cyborg]] in the year 2053. 

He is a black haired young man who uses [[sunglasses]] to conceal his eyes, since the augmentation he possess causes them to shine with an unnatural blue light.

h4. See also

* [[Adam Jensen]]

title: cthulhu
body:
[b]Cthulhu[/b] is a fictional cosmic entity created by horror author [[h_p_lovecraft|H. P. Lovecraft]] in 1926, first appearing in the short story "The Call of Cthulhu" when it was published in Weird Tales in 1928.

Cthulhu is one of the central Great Old Ones of the [[Cthulhu Mythos]]. It is often cited for the extreme descriptions given of its hideous appearance (which includes green skin, gargoyle wings and a squid shaped head), its gargantuan size, and the abject insanity inducing terror that it evokes on the persons unlucky enough to watch him.

title: younger_sister_(elona)
body:
A minor semi-hidden character in [[Elona]], the Younger Sister can be found either in the hidden "Mansion of Younger Sister", where a younger sister merchant sells homemade lunches, (that restore Sanity that you might lose after casting magic while confused or fighting the [[Cthulhu Mythos]]-inspired enemies in the game,) or else by reading a "Little Sister's Diary", which causes a Younger Sister to appear in your party.  (The latter is a reference to [[Chokotto Sister]], where the main character gets a "younger sister" for Christmas from Santa, complete with a notebook/diary instructing her on how to be a good one.)

In game, Younger Sisters appear with random names, as in, "Anita, the younger sister". Because there is no single name, just the "class" name is used.

Younger Sister appears with green twin pigtails with yellow ribbons and a red dress.  She's also often much shorter than most other characters in a work.

title: wanijima_akito
body:
A character from the manga [[Air Gear]] by [[Oogure Ito]].
He is known as The Fang King of the Blood Road, and he has a [[dual persona|split-personality]]. His other persona being [[Wanijima Agito]].

Akito's presence can be visibly seen by his eyepatch, which is worn on the [b]right eye[/b].

He is very non-violent and innocent, he displays a great kindness toward others (especially toward [[Itsuki Minami|Ikki]]). Around his brother Kaito - he seems to show a small fear, but deep love for him. Since he and Agito are one in the same, he is gladly apart of Team Kogarasumaru.

title: itsuki_minami
body:
The main protagonist of the manga [[Air Gear]] by [[Oogure Ito]]. Known as "Ikki" by his friends; and given nicknames such as "Baby Face" and "Lil Crow" by other Air Trek Riders.

Ikki is free spirited and has a natural affiliation for being in the sky, he can be very eccentric and pushy, but does focus on the goals he wants to achieve. He stays with the Noyamano family, whom he lives with due to his parents' deaths. It was the Noyamano sisters who gave Ikki his first pair of ATs.

He formed his own Team called "Kogarasumaru (小烏丸)". Which consist of his friends: Mikura Kazuma "Kazu", Onigiri, Issa Mihotoke "Buccha", [[Wanijima Agito]], and Adachi Emily.

As the story moves on, Ikki is considered a candidate to be Sky King; later he moves onto a road for himself - as the Storm King.

title: wanijima_agito
body:
A character from the manga [[Air Gear]] by [[Oogure Ito]].
He is known as The Fang King of the Blood Road, and he has a [[dual persona|split-personality]]. His other persona being [[Wanijima Akito]].

Agito's presence can be visibly seen by his eyepatch, which is worn on the [b]left eye[/b].

He is very violent and disrespectful toward others, except when he is around his brother Kaito. Yet later in the series he actually develops some form of respect for [[Itsuki Minami|Ikki]], he even ends up joining Team Kogarasumaru.

title: noyamano_ringo
body:
A character from the manga [[Air Gear]] by [[Oogure Ito]].

She is in Team Sleeping Forest (眠りの森, Nemuri no Mori), and is later dubbed Thorn Queen, of the Sonia Road.

Her teammates (who are also her sisters) are [[Noyamano Rika]], [[Noyamano Mikan]], [[Noyamano Shiraume]].

She developed a crush on [[Itsuki Minami|Ikki]] which gradually turned into love, though she dare not confront him about it. While Ikki is oblivious to it.

During Ikki's AT battles, Ringo created an alter-ego called [[Croissant Mask]]- to help out Team Kogarasumaru.

title: hagane_vocaloid
body:
h4. Hagane (鋼音)

A collective name for a group of derivative [[Vocaloid]] characters illustrated by [[Hanji (Hansi)]] (aka. Hansi) and [[Momopanda]]. The characters are based on the Vocaloids produced by Crypton Future Media, given a heavy metal persona and also known as Type-H or Type-M by their respective artist.

Only Hagane Miku's surname is shared by both artists. And it is Momopanda that has created Internet Co. Ltd based Hagane types.

body:
Chika is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Internet Co., Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. 

She was voiced by (AAA) singer, Itou Chiaki. Wearing a style similar to her voice provider. She wears a [[frilled dress|frilly dress]] with a criss-cross top. She has [[ankle boots]], [[hair ribbon]]s, and pink [[earrings]]. Her [[pink hair]] is styled into curly [[double bun|buns]].

title: planetarian
body:
planetarian ～ちいさなほしのゆめ～ ("Planetarian: [i]Chiisana Hoshi no Yume[/i]", "Planetarian: The Dream of a Little Planet") is a [[science fiction]] visual novel developed by [[key_(company)|Key]]. Because it offers no choices or alternate endings, Visual Art's co.,ltd (the publisher) calls it a Kinetic Novel. It was adapted into a light novel and [[drama CD]]s. 

It was later ported to the [[Playstation 2]]. 

A [[Playstation Portable]] version has also been developed: 
planetarian～ちいさなほしのゆめ～ 東北地方太平洋沖地震被災地チャリティー版 
("Planetarian ~Chiisana Hoshi no Yume~ Special Edition for Tohoku Earthquake"). As the name implies, sales proceeds go directly to helping victims of the 2011 Japan earthquake and tsunami disaster. 

h4.Characters 

* "[[Junker]]" ([i]Kuzuya[/i], the nameless protagonist) 
* [[Hoshino Yumemi]] (aka. [[Reverie]]) 
* [[Mk43L/e]] Auto Gunner (aka. shiomaneki/fiddler crab) 

h4.Novel characters

title: valkyrie_(p&d)
body:
A set of visually similar characters from [[Puzzle & Dragons]] based on Norse Valkyries. Initially the Valkyries use a [[sword]] and [[shield]]. They later [[dual wielding|dual wield]] swords in their second-to-last forms and start to become more visual distinct from one another. In their finals forms they have a distinct weapon, gain a name, and are more distinct visually.

Subtypes:

* [[light_valkyrie_(p&d)|Light Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Divine Law Goddess, Valkyrie Rose)
* [[dark_valkyrie_(p&d)|Dark Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Black-Winged Goddess, Valkyrie Claire)
* [[water_valkyrie_(p&d)|Water Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Azure Goddess, Valkyrie Reine)
* [[wood_valkyrie_(p&d)|Wood Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Thorned Goddess, Valkyrie Elize)
* [[fire_valkyrie_(p&d)|Fire Valkyrie]] (ultimate form: Phoenix Goddess, Valkyrie Femme)

title: krizalid
body:
The mid and final boss of King of Fighters '99. He was created as a clone of K', but Krizalid refuses to believe this and thinks that K' is his clone.

He also believed that he is [[Whip (KoF)|Whip]]'s brother, thanks to having K's memories while cloning him. He was ordered to activate thousands of [[Kusanagi Kyou|Kyo]] clones around the world with his suit.

In order to gather the battle data necessary for the activation period, he fights the winning team of the tournament. After his defeat, his superior, [[Zero (KoF)|Zero]] neutralizes the Kyo clones and kills Krizalid by throwing a boulder to crush him. [[Heidern]] inquires if Krizalid remembers his real name. He simply cannot remember and dies shortly after.

He is revived later by the original [[Original Zero|Zero]] and fights alongside him in the [[the King of Fighters 2001|2001 tournament]]. What happened to him following the battle is unknown. He has yet to make another canonical appearance since then.

Some fanarts depict Krizalid paired with [[Touhou]]'s [[Hong Meiling]], due to the fact that one of her Skill cards resembles his Typhoon Rage.

title: dipodal_saucer
body:
A character from the [[Strider (video game)]] franchise. It appears in the original Strider arcade videogame from 1989 as well as the [[Marvel vs. Capcom]] series of fighting games released years later.

The [b]Dipodal Saucer[/b] (also known as [b]Option A[/b]) is a small mushroom shaped type of floating combat [[robot]] with two legs that helps the main character [[Strider Hiryuu]] during his quest. These robots are very maneuverable and move very fast, can generate energy rings which obliterate the enemies and have a minimal hovering capacity thanks to their micro antigravity generators.

h4. See also

* [[Tetrapodal Mecha Panther]]
